repnme.cdata!:
Zambia - Privatization and Industrial
            Reform Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Privatization and Industrial Reform
            Technical Assistance Project's outcome was
            satisfactory. The project achieved all its objectives. The
            lessons drawn from this project are: 1) timely intervention
            by provision of technical and financial assistance to a
            program greatly facilitates implementation of a program as
            the technical assistance makes acquisition of critical
            expertise and procurement of necessary equipment, vehicles,
            and training possible; 2) establishment of new institutions
            can take longer than is expected; 3) careful selection of
            key management staff can make a difference between success
            and failure of a program and so is stability of staff in a
            project; and 4) beneficiaries of a project should be
            involved in pre-assistance identification of activities to
            be performed as this facilitates quick implementation of a
            project/program and improves sustainability.

18153717.theme: Law reform,Income Support for Old Age, Disability & Survivorship,Other financial and private sector development,State-owned enterprise restructuring and privatization
18153717.majtheme: Rule of law,Social protection and risk management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Zambia - Privatization and Industrial
            Reform Technical Assistance Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The credit strengthens the capabilities
            of the ministries and other institutions responsible for the
            parastatal reform and privatization program, and for the
            macroeconomic and institutional reforms needed to improve
            the environment for a thriving private sector. The credit
            finances consultants' services, training, equipment and
            services for the following components: a) development and
            implementation of a privatization program for 105
            parastatals; b) development of the country's private
            sector; c) implementation of reforms in the six utilities;
            d) formulation and delivery of a Social Action Plan to
            provide a safety net for those affected by the reforms; and
            e) training of Zambian officials in the relevant aspects of
            the program.
